title: Header will stick to the top when scrolled to the top
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting a club page within environment context (beta-gcp.mlb.com/guardian || mlb.com/guardians etc.)
AND I am using a mobile device of any size
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the bottom of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the header sticking to the top of the page
AND the header will be visible to user at all times

title: Sticky header will not contain ad displayed on top of the header when scrolled at all viewports
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting a club page within environment context (beta-gcp.mlb.com/guardian || mlb.com/guardians etc.)
AND I am using a mobile device of any size
AND I see an ad on top of the header
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the bottom of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the header sticking to the top of the page
AND the header will be visible to user at all times
AND I should NOT see any ad sticking above the header

title: Sponsor logo in the header will not be visible after scrolling
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting a club page within environment context (beta-gcp.mlb.com/guardian || mlb.com/guardians etc.)
AND the club header contains a sponsor in the header (Guardians || Reds || Mets etc)
AND I am using a mobile device of any size
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the bottom of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the header sticking to the top of the page
AND the header will be visible to user at all times
AND I should not see the sponsored ad in the sticky nav

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am visiting the URL in a desktop browser
AND I resize the browser window to its responsive mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I should see the header sticking to the top of the page
AND the header will be visible to user at all times
AND I should not see the sponsored ad in the sticky nav

title: Headline stack will not have any spot tags across all platforms
Headline stack can be tagged with team or player or MLB spot logos but will not be displayed on Headline Stack section
Make an API call to retrieve the headline stack information
Clicking on a Headline stack link will trigger an analytics call
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on Mets homepage
AND I am viewing the Headline stack for the team
custom_steps:
WHEN I click on the 2nd (index 1) link
AND I am observing the Network calls with ss/ filter on
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a call 
AND I should see the following values:
**c12**: *Content Navigation: Headline Stack*
**c13**: *New York Mets: Homepage*
**c14**: *Content Navigation: Headline Stack: News: `${title_of_the_link}`*
**v84**: *1*
**pe**: *lnk_o*
**pev2**: *News: `${title_of_the_link}`*

title: Clicking on View All Headline stack link will trigger an analytics call
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on Mets homepage
AND I am viewing the Headline stack for the team
custom_steps:
WHEN I click on the View All link
AND I am observing the Network calls with ss/ filter on
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a call 
AND I should see the following values:
**c12**: *Content Navigation: Headline Stack*
**c13**: *New York Mets: Homepage*
**c14**: *Content Navigation: Headline Stack: News: View Allpe: lnk_o*
**pe**: *lnk_o*
**pev2**: *View All*

title: Verify the breakpoints at different viewport
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a club homepage
AND I have React Component extension installed on my browser
AND I have it enabled and open
custom_steps:
WHEN I am viewing the page in mobile view
AND I look into the `Context.Provider` in BreakpointsProvider section of the Components dev tools section
custom_expected: THEN I should see "small" for the `Context.Provider` value

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am viewing the page in browser responsive view
AND I set the viewport to 768 px
AND I look into the `Context.Provider` in BreakpointsProvider section of the Components dev tools section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see "medium" for the `Context.Provider` value

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am viewing the page in browser responsive view
AND I set the viewport to 1024 px
AND I look into the `Context.Provider` in BreakpointsProvider section of the Components dev tools section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see "large" for the `Context.Provider` value

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am viewing the page in browser responsive view
AND I set the viewport to 1280 px
AND I look into the `Context.Provider` in BreakpointsProvider section of the Components dev tools section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see "xlarge" for the `Context.Provider` value

title: Club pages will contain a promotion and giveaways module
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a team's homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected: THEN I should see Promotions & Giveaways section

title: Each promotion will have an image
Each promotion will contain a Ticket Info button
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a team's homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see some promos
AND I should see images with each promotion
AND I should see Ticket Info button with each promotion

title: Tickets Info button will land on the ticketing page
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a team's homepage
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
AND I press on Ticket Info for a promotion
custom_expected: THEN I land on the ticketing page for that promotion

title: Each promotion will contain the opposition team logo
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a team's homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see some promos
AND I should see the opposition team's logo for a promotion

title: Each promotion will contain the game date & time | TBD
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a team's homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see some promos
AND I should see game date 
AND I should see game time or TBD

title: There will be a carousel containing promotions & giveaways
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a team's homepage on a large or XL viewport
AND the team page contains at least 4 promotions
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see at least 3 promos
AND I should be able to scroll horizontally

title: Carousel will be scrollable horizontally when there is more promo to view in a given viewport
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a team's homepage using large or XL viewport
AND the team contains at least 5 promotions
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should be able to scroll the promotions horizontally
AND I should see arrows to scroll the promotions

title: Promo & Giveaways will contain a View All button [configure in Forge]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a team's homepage
AND the View All section is filled in with a valid URL in Forge (CMS)
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected: THEN I should see a View All link

title: On hand held devices, there won't be any  arrows to scroll horizontally!
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a team's homepage on a phone (hand-held device)
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should NOT see any horizontal scrolling arrow
AND I should be able to scroll with mobile gesture

title: Clicking on a Promotion Ticket Info button will bring the event game box on the ticketing page and it will bring the game the promotion is for
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a team's homepage
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll to the Promotions & Giveaways section of the page
AND I see a promotion for 5/15 (or any date available)
AND I click on the Ticket Info button for that promotion
custom_expected:
THEN I should be taken to the tickets page
AND I should see a modal with that specific game promotion
AND I should see the same promotion details on the modal as shown in the team's promotion list

title: View All link should land on a club page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on Yankees club page
AND View All link is configured in Forge to go to /tickets/promotions page
custom_steps: WHEN I click on View All link
custom_expected: THEN I should land on /yankees/tickets/promotions page

title: Clicking on a promo link will trigger a tracking event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a team's page
AND I see team related promotions
custom_steps:
WHEN I click on a promotion's Ticket Info button
AND I am viewing the tracking event in Network console (filter by ss/)
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the following data in the event:

c12	promos and giveaways
c13	New York Mets: Homepage
c14	promo click

pe	lnk_o
pev2	Single Admission Doubleheader

page	New York<Team Name>: Homepage
link	Ticket Info

title: Clicking on a promo image will trigger a tracking event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a Marlins page
AND I see Marlin's related promotions
AND I see a promotion as shown in the shared image![](index.php?/attachments/get/14859797)
custom_steps:
WHEN I click on a promotion's image
AND I am viewing the tracking event in Network console
AND I have the Network calls filtered by ss/
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the following key values in the payload for the event:
c12: Miami Marlins: Promos and Giveaways
c13: Miami Marlins: Homepage
c14: Miami Marlins: Promos and Giveaways: Promo Click
v48: Miami Marlins: Homepage
c52: Miami Marlins: Homepage
pe: lnk_o
pev2: Beach Towel presented by Curacao

title: On a desktop browser, on first visit, there will be 4 tracking events populating
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting a club homepage on a desktop browser in full width, i.e. www.yankees.com
AND I am tracking the Network calls
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll to the Promos & Giveaways section
AND I am filtering the Network calls with "ss/"
custom_expected:
THEN I should see 4 tracking events populating
AND I should be able to verify the following items:
c12: "<Team Name>: Promos and Giveaways"
c13:<Team Name>: Homepage
c14:<Team Name>: Promos and Giveaways: Promo Impression
pev2:"<Promo Name || title of the promotion> ", // The text CTA on the promo, must match the cooresponding value in the Promo Click event for the Promo Card
pe: lnk_o
AND I should be able to verify the above data for all 4 visible promotions

title: On an iPad or a tablet browser, on first visit, there will be 3 tracking events populating
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting a club homepage on a desktop browser in full width, i.e. www.yankees.com
AND I am tracking the Network calls
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll to the Promos & Giveaways section
AND I am filtering the Network calls with "ss/"
custom_expected:
THEN I should see 3 tracking events populating
AND I should be able to verify the following items:
c12: "<Team Name>: Promos and Giveaways"
c13:<Team Name>: Homepage
c14:<Team Name>: Promos and Giveaways: Promo Impression
pev2:"<Promo Name || title of the promotion> ", // The text CTA on the promo, must match the cooresponding value in the Promo Click event for the Promo Card
pe: lnk_o
AND I should be able to verify the above data for all 3 visible promotions

title: On a phone browser, on first visit, there will be 1 tracking event populating
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting a club homepage on a desktop browser in full width, i.e. www.yankees.com
AND I am tracking the Network calls
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll to the Promos & Giveaways section
AND I am filtering the Network calls with "ss/"
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a tracking event populating
AND I should be able to verify the following items:
c12: "<Team Name>: Promos and Giveaways"
c13:<Team Name>: Homepage
c14:<Team Name>: Promos and Giveaways: Promo Impression
pev2:"<Promo Name || title of the promotion> ", // The text CTA on the promo, must match the cooresponding value in the Promo Click event for the Promo Card
pe: lnk_o

title: In a small viewport, there will be 4 ads of different sizes
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the club page in a medium viewport
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll along the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see 4 ads in different sizes:
slot1 [Nav Bar]: 320x50
slot2 [Feed]: 300x250, 320x50
slot3 [Feed]: 320x50, 300x600, 300x250
slot4 [Feed]: 320x50

title: In a Medium viewport, there will be 4 ads of different sizes
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the club page in a medium viewport
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll along the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see 4 ads in different sizes:
slot1 [Nav Bar]: 728x90
slot2 [Feed]: 728x90
slot3 [Feed]: 728x90
slot4 [Feed]: 728x90

title: In a Large viewport, there will be 4 ads of different sizes
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the club page in a large viewport
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll along the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see 4 ads in different sizes:
slot1 [Nav Bar]: 970x250, 728x90
slot2 [Feed]: 970x250, 728x90
slot3 [Feed]: 970x250, 728x90
slot4 [Feed]: 970x250, 728x90

title: Verify Ads call in Network tab
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am a new redesigned club homepage
AND I have Network tab open
AND I am filtering the calls using "ads?"
custom_steps:
WHEN I am looking at the Network tab
AND I
AND I
custom_expected:
THEN I should see some ads related call
AND I should see the following value in the Network response: *iu_parts: 2605,mets.mlb,xhomepage,slot_1,phone,ios,ticketing,slot_2,slot_3,slot_4* in the payload

title: Verify MLBTV ad values
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am home a club home page
AND I have Network calls filtered by 'ss/'
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll down to mlb.tv 
AND I click on mlb.tv ad
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a call triggering
AND I should see the following values in the call:
c12: MLB.TV: Ad Click
c13: New York Mets: Homepage
c14: MLB.TV: Ad Click :CLUBMLBTVTAB
pe: lnk_o
pev2: https://www.mlb.com/network/shows/caribbean-series?&affiliateId=CLUBMLBTVTAB

title: There should a  content collection module/section
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I look into the Forge configuration for the Mets page
custom_expected: THEN I should see a Content Collection module defined

title: Content collection will have a title
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps:
WHEN I look into the Forge configuration for the Mets page
AND I see the CCollection title is "Mets Insider"
custom_expected: THEN I should see "Mets Insider" as the content collection title

title: Content collection may or may not have View All button
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps:
WHEN I look into the Forge configuration for the Mets page
AND I see the Content Collection URL value is blank
custom_expected: THEN I should NOT see the View All button next to the Content Collection header

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I look into the Forge configuration for the Mets page
AND I see the Content Collection URL value is filled with a URL value
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the View All button next to the Content Collection header

title: View All button will appear once the url is defined in forge
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps:
WHEN I look into the Forge configuration for the Mets page
AND I see the Content Collection URL value is filled with a URL value
custom_expected: THEN I should see the View All button next to the Content Collection header

title: On a small viewport, the following videos will push down after the main video
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I resize my browser to 700 px
custom_expected: THEN I should see the related videos cascading under the main video

title: Content displaying on the Content collection module can be controlled in Forge. So, if Forge  CMS dictates 2 videos to display, then there will be 1 related video and 1 main video.
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps:
WHEN I look into the Forge configuration for the Mets page
AND I see the Content Collection 'Limit num. of items' is set to 5
custom_expected: THEN I should see a total of 5 items in the UI

title: Clicking on a video will land on its related href [URL]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
AND there is a video listed in the Content Collection module
custom_steps: WHEN I click on the video
custom_expected: THEN I should be navigated to its link (away fro the page)

title: Each content title will be clickable
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I click on each item on the Content Collection module list
custom_expected: THEN I should see the article|video loading

title: Each content will have a published date
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I view each item on the Content Collection module list
custom_expected: THEN I should see a published date

title: Published date will be of the following format: MMM DD[TH/ST/ND], YYYY AUG 2ND, 2023 JUN 28TH, 2027 etc.
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
custom_steps: WHEN I view each item on the Content Collection module list
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a published date
AND I should see the date format as following: MMM DD (TH, ST, ND), YYYY
FOR EXAMPLE: JUN 20TH, 2021

title: Video content will NOT play within the player or the Content Collection module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am visiting the Mets redesigned homepage
AND I see a video in the Content Collection
custom_steps: WHEN I click on the the video
custom_expected: THEN I should be navigated away

title: Viewport 1280px and larger
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a club homepage on a desktop
custom_steps: WHEN I resize the viewport to 1280px or more
custom_expected:
THEN I should see main video content with a large image
AND I should see the image taking up 2/3 of the horizontal viewport

title: Viewport below 1280px
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a club homepage on a desktop
custom_steps: WHEN I resize the viewport to 1279px or less
custom_expected:
THEN I should see main video content with a large image
AND I should see the image taking up 1/2 of the horizontal viewport (50:50)

title: There should be a Newsletter module
Users should see a Sign up button for Newsletter sign up
Newsletter module is driven by GraphQL
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting Mets hp

title: Newsletter will be driven by contentful config
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have a team's page
custom_steps: WHEN I go to https://app.contentful.com/spaces/iiozhi00a8lc/entries/1uhDWHrNvsUVsGJSCp7HhJ?focusedField=internalName
custom_expected: THEN I should see Newsletter module for the Mets

title: Verify Newsletter module details
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on Mets homepage
AND I have the contentful config open for the Mets
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the Contentful config title matching with the tile in Mets hp: Get updates from the Mets
AND I should see the Contentful config description matching with the description in Mets hp: Receive the latest Mets news, ticket information, and more - just for you!

title: There will be a videos module
In a large viewport, the video list will be on the right hand side of the module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
AND I am using a browser on a computer 
AND my viewport is over 1024px
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Latest Videos module
AND I should see list of videos on the right hand side

title: In a medium to small viewport, the video list will be under video player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
AND I am using a browser on a computer 
AND my viewport is less than 1024px
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Latest Videos module
AND I should see list of videos under the main video playing

title: Each video will have timestamp of the format: 3 letter month 2-digit day with (th, st, nd ), 4-digit year
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page [platform or browser version should not matter)
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Latest Videos module
AND I should see each video with a timestamp i.e. FEB 10TH, 2025

title: Videos should autoplay
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
AND I observe the video player for about an hour (enough time for all videos to play)
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Latest Videos module
AND I should see videos autoplaying 1 after another

title: After the last video, it will loop back to the top of the video list and play
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
AND I observe the video player playing each video until the last video on the list
custom_expected: THEN I should see the player playing to the 1st video again

title: There will be a list of 10 videos at any given time
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Latest Videos module
AND I should see videos list
AND I should see 10 video items on the video playlist

title: [Forge] View All text is configured by CTA field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
AND I have access to the Forge page for this club page configuration
AND the Forge config page is open
AND the CTA field has the value of "View All"
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Latest Videos module
AND I should see View All displaying next to Latest Videos text

title: [Forge] When CTA field is empty, there won't be a link available in the UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
AND I have access to the Forge page for this club page configuration
AND the Forge config page is open
AND the CTA field is left blank
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Latest Videos module
AND I should NOT see any link or text next to Latest Videos

title: [Forge]  For a club, clicking on View All text will load the page with VTP slug entered in Forge
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
AND I have access to the Forge page for this club page configuration
AND the Forge config page is open
AND the CTA field has the value of "View All"
AND the VTP Slug field has the value of "t147-default-vtp"
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
AND I click on View All link
custom_expected: THEN I should see the page loading with /video/topic/t147-default-vtp

title: [Forge]  For the Mets, when CTA field is available, and the VTP slug value is entered as: t147-default-vtp, Clicking on the CTA string is left blank, then clicking the CTA text in UI will bring the team video page with topic:t121-default-vtp
[Forge] Team's video module is powered by the topic/slug value entered in VTP slug value.
There should NOW PLAYING indicator text on a video which is playing
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on a redesigned club page
AND I am using a browser on a computer
custom_steps:
WHEN I scroll about midway of the page
AND  I see a video playing
custom_expected: THEN I should see NOW PLAYING text on a video in the Video List

title: An article tagged with a PresBy ad will show the ad
[en] PresBy ads will contain the text "Presented by"
Clicking on the ad will redirect to the sponsor page
[es] PresBy ads will contain the text "Presentado por"
